isis.stitle: DCM AND DDM DRUM TYPE PARKING BRAKE - BENDIX AIR AND HYDRAULIC ACTUATED PARKING BRAKE - OPERATION

svcprocinfo.para: The parking brake is applied by manually pulling the parking brake control knob. Air or hydraulic pressure will hold the brake in the parked position. It should not be used to brake the vehicle during normal driving.

svcsubproc.title: Air Actuated Parking Brake
svcsubproc.para: The air actuated parking brake is equipped with an air gauge and warning light. When air pressure in the parking brake air storage system has been reduced to approximately 70 psi (483 kPA), the light will activate.
If air pressure is reduced to approximately 30 psi (207 kPA), the parking brake control knob will automatically pop out and apply the parking brake.
It should be noted that upon loss of air pressure, partial parking brake application will occur prior to automatic application of the control valve.

warning.para: If air system pressure falls below 70 psi (483 kPA), the vehicle should not be moved.

svcsubproc.title: Air or Hydraulic Actuated Parking Brake
svcsubproc.para: To release the parking brake, have the engine running and your foot on the service brake pedal, then push in the parking brake control knob and shift out of park. If the parking brake will not release and the vehicle must be moved, the spring chamber must be manually released (caged) by turning the adjusting nut on the push rod clockwise until bottomed on the chamber ( Figure 31).

warning.para: When manually releasing the spring chamber assembly, be sure to block the wheels so that the vehicle cannot move when the parking brake is released. This will prevent vehicle movement which could result in possible property damage and personal injury.
Under no circumstances should the spring chamber be disassembled. Disassembly will release a powerful spring that may cause severe personal injury or death.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Actuated Parking Brake Circuit
svcsubproc.para: The following explanation is with the engine running.

Parking brake control valve out- transmission in park position. Refer to Figure 32 for all Items in parentheses. Hydraulic pressure is present at the supply port of the HR-1 valve (Item 4) and the supply port of the parking brake push-pull control valve TW-11 (Item 1). The parking brake (Item 3) remains in the engaged position.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Parking Brake Control Valve Out - Transmission in Park Position

svcsubproc.para: Parking brake control valve in- transmission in park position. Refer to Figure 33 for all Items in parentheses. Hydraulic pressure is present at the supply port of the HR-1 valve (Item 4) and the supply port of the parking brake push-pull control valve TW-11 (Item 1). With the control valve TW-11 in the IN position, pressure is available at the supply port of relay valve TW-12 (Item 2) located at the transmission and connected to the shift linkage. With the transmission in the park position, the pressure is exhausted. The parking brake remains engaged.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Parking Brake Control Valve In - Transmission in Park Position

svcsubproc.para: Parking brake control valve in- transmission shifted out of park position. Refer to Figure 34 for all Items in parentheses. Hydraulic pressure flows through HR-1 valve (Item 4) and the parking brake push pull control valve TW-11 to relay valve TW-12 (Item 2). With the transmission shifted out of park, pressure flows to the control port of relay valve HR-1 (Item 4) opening a path to pressurize the spring brake chamber (Item 3) releasing the parking brake. Excess hydraulic pressure flows through the reservoir port of relay valve HR-1 (Item 4). The parking brake is released and the vehicle may be driven.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Parking Brake Control Valve In - Transmission Shifted Out of Park Position

note.para: After initial vehicle operation, the parking brake can be applied by shifting the transmission into the park position or by moving the parking brake push pull control valve TW-11 (Item 1) to the OUT position.

svcsubproc.para: Parking brake control valve out - transmission in gear or neutral. Refer to Figure 35 for all Items in parentheses. Hydraulic pressure flows through the relay valve HR-1 (Item 4) to the parking brake push pull control valve TW-11 (Item 1). With the valve in the OUT position, hydraulic pressure flow is diverted to the exhaust port. The absence of pressure at the control port of relay valve HR-1 (Item 4) opens a path for the spring brake chamber (Item 3) to exhaust hydraulic pressure allowing the parking brake to engage.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Parking Brake Control Valve Out - Transmission in Gear or Neutral

svcsubproc.para: Parking brake control valve in - transmission shifted to park position. Refer to Figure 36 for all Items in parentheses. Hydraulic pressure flows through relay valve HR-1 (Item 4) and the parking brake push pull control valve TW-11 (Item 1) to the supply port of relay valve TW-12 (Item 2). With the relay valve TW-12 (Item 2) in the park position, the hydraulic pressure flow is diverted to the exhaust port. The absence of pressure at the control port of relay valve HR-1 (Item 4) opens a path for the spring brake chamber (Item 3) to exhaust hydraulic pressure allowing the parking brake to engage.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Parking Brake Control Valve in - Transmission Shifted to Park Position
